title: Preparing and Cooking Organ Meats
brief: Safely prepare and cook organ meats to maximize nutritional benefits in survival situations.
steps: Step 1: Save heart, liver, pancreas, spleen, and kidneys during butchering.
Step 2: Cut organs open and inspect for worms or parasites.
Step 3: Check liver color - should be smooth, wet, and deep red or purple.
Step 4: Discard liver if diseased, but muscle meat may still be safe.
Step 5: Cook organs using same methods as muscle meat.
Step 6: For tongue: cut out, skin it, boil until tender.
Step 7: Brain can be cooked and eaten like other organs.
warnings: Always inspect organs for signs of disease before consuming.
Diseased liver doesn't necessarily mean muscle meat is unsafe.
Cook all organ meats thoroughly to kill potential parasites.
